Welcome to the SAFEXPRESS LOGISTICS INC. team! 
You are now part of a dynamic and ISO 9001:2015 QMS Certified company committed to

use it as a resource to uphold the high standards of Safety, Quality, Delivery, Cost, and

</s> <s=11> Welcome to the SAFEXPRESS LOGISTICS INC. team!


You are now part of a dynamic and ISO 9001:2015 QMS Certified company committed to
delivering reliable, compliant logistics solutions across the Philippines. Our success is driven by
our people—a skilled and experienced team dedicated to operational excellence. This manual is
your guide to our company's policies, culture, standards, and expectations. We trust that you will

*Morale that define the Safexpress family.*

results.text: Achievements/Responsibilities: - Served as Project Manager for a bakeshop attendance and salary computation web application (MERN stack), leading end-to-end project execution from client consultation to delivery, gathering and validating requirements, contributing to system architecture and business logic, evaluating technical approaches, resolving design issues, managing tasks via Trello, coordinating stakeholder communication, preparing SPMP/SRS/SDD documentation, and performing comprehensive scenario-based manual testing to ensure system quality and alignment with project standards.
results.context: Project management experience in web application development

<s=12> *Safexpress Logistics Inc.*


*Company Safety Rules & Regulations*


*1. General Safety & Conduct*


</s> <s=11> *Safety First: Safety is the primary Key Performance Indicator (KPI) in every decision.* •
</s> <s=12> The goal is Zero Accidents and Injuries.


</s> <s=11> *Adherence to Procedures: All employees must strictly adhere to all safety rules,* •
</s> <s=12> procedures, and Work Instructions (WI).


</s> <s=11> *Hazard Reporting: You must identify and report all potential hazards, near-misses,* •
</s> <s=12> and unsafe conditions immediately to your direct supervisor or the HSE Officer.


</s> <s=11> *Training Participation: Active participation in all safety training and drills is* •
</s> <s=12> mandatory.


*2. Personal Protective Equipment (PPE)*


</s> <s=11> *Mandatory Wear: Employees must wear the required PPE for their assigned tasks* •
</s> <s=12> and work areas at all times.


*Speciﬁc Requirements:*


</s> <s=11> *High Visibility Vests: Required at all

ADMINISTRATION

4.3 Training and Development 
SAFEXPRESS LOGISTICS INC. values continuous learning. The company provides ongoing 
training to maintain a skilled team and sustain the best service for our customers. Employees 
are expected to actively participate in all mandatory training sessions related to safety, quality, 
and new technology (e.g., WMS updates). 
 
This document is a sample and should be finalized by the SAFEXPRESS LOGISTICS INC. 
management and HR department with specific legal and regulatory clauses, detailed job

ACHIEVEMENTS/RESPONSIBILITY

● Led the development of a logistics company web application integrating Agentic AI with LLM capabilities for knowledge base querying, AI assistant task automation, and dynamic data mapping and entry. Utilized Python, LangChain, LangGraph, and OpenAI LLM and embedding models as Capstone Project (currently in development).
● Served as Project Manager for a bakeshop attendance and salary computation web application using the MERN stack (MongoDB, Express.js, React, Node.js)

<s=23> *SAFEXPRESS LOGISTICS INC.*


</s> <s=17> *HEALTH, SAFETY & ENVIRONMENT (HSE) MANUAL*


*SECTION 1: HSE POLICY & COMMITMENT*


</s> <s=13> *1.1 HSE Mission Statement*


</s> <s=11> SAFEXPRESS LOGISTICS INC. is committed to providing a safe, healthy, and environmentally


*responsible workplace for all employees, contractors, and visitors. Our goal is Zero Accidents*


*and Injuries. We integrate Safety as the primary KPI in every operational decision, ensuring*


compliance with all Philippine laws and international standards for logistics and warehousing.


</s> <s=13> *1.2 Management Responsibilities*


</s> <s=11> Management is responsible for:


● *Providing necessary Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) and ensuring its proper*


use.


● Conducting regular safety audits and risk assessments across all sites (warehouses,


yards, and fleet operations).


● Implementing corrective actions for all reported safety deficiencies and hazards.


</s> <s=13> *1.3 Employee R

2.1 Our Identity 
SAFEXPRESS LOGISTICS INC. is a dynamic logistics company providing end-to-end supply 
chain solutions, specializing in efficient warehousing, distribution, freight management, 
transportation, and value-added services nationwide.

Technical Skills: Java, C++, JavaScript, PHP, MySQL, Kotlin, Firebase, C#, ASP.NET, AngularJs, React, Express.js, Node.js, MongoDB, Python, Django, FastAPI, Laravel, HTML, CSS, Bootstrap, Tailwind CSS

SECTION 1: INTRODUCTION AND WELCOME

● Dispatch: Switch to manual dispatch procedures using pre-printed Delivery Order (DO) and Bill of Lading (BOL) forms. Log all movements via secure chat groups.
● Warehouse: Halt all non-critical picking/packing. Receiving must be done manually, creating handwritten Receiving Reports. No movement of High-Value Cargo without dual sign-off.
● Data: Once systems are restored, all manual records must be prioritized for data entry to meet RPO of 12 hours for WMS data.

results.text:
1.2 Purpose of the Manual 
This manual serves as the definitive reference for all employees regarding the standards, 
policies, and procedures of SAFEXPRESS LOGISTICS INC. Its purpose is to ensure a unified, 
safe, and efficient working environment where every team member understands their role in 
meeting customer expectations and achieving business objectives.

must perform a Daily Vehicle Inspection Report (DVIR) before operating any*

● *No use of mobile phones or electronic devices while the vehicle is in motion.*


</s> <s=13> *3.2 Fatigue Management*


</s> <s=11> ● Drivers must adhere strictly to mandated driving hours and rest periods to prevent


fatigue-related accidents.

safely.

<s=13> *_ 4.0 Disaster Scenario: Major Power and Network Outage _*


</s> <s=11> *_ 4.1 Response and Activation _*


_1._ *_ Immediate Action: IC to declare Level 2 (Major Disruption). _*
_2._ *_ Communication: Activate satellite/backup communication devices. Notify all critical _*
_personnel via SMS/alternative channel._
_3._ *_ WMS/IT: IT Lead immediately switches to off-site cloud servers (if applicable) or initiates _*
*_ Backup & Recovery Procedure (Refer to IT Manual). _*


*_ 4.2 Logistics Continuity Protocol _*


_●_ *_ Dispatch: Switch to manual dispatch procedures using pre-printed Delivery Order (DO) _*
*_ and Bill of Lading (BOL) forms. Log all movements via secure chat groups. _*
_●_ *_ Warehouse: Halt all non-critical picking/packing. Receiving must be done manually, _*
*_ creating handwritten Receiving Reports. No movement of High-Value Cargo without _*
_dual sign-off._
_●_ *_ Data: Once systems are restored,

Role | Responsibility | Backup Contact
Incident Commander (IC) | Overall decision-making authority. Declares disaster level. | Head of Operations
Logistics Lead | Manages fleet safety, cargo integrity, and alternative delivery routes. | Senior Dispatch Manager
IT & Systems Lead | Manages system recovery, data restoration, and access to backup servers. | WMS Administrator
HR & Safety Lead | Personnel accounting, staff welfare, and site safety clearance. | HR Manager
